abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Sector Technical Assistance
            Credit for Bosnia and Herzegovina had the following ratings:
            the outcome was unsatisfactory, the sustainability was
            likely, the institutional development impact was modest, and
            the Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            The lessons learned indicate that the pairing of a TA
            operation with an adjustment lending is an excellent
            combination and can lead to the successful implementation of
            difficult reform program. If technical assistance projects
            like Social Sector Technical Assistance Credit (SOTAC) are
            being designed as a companion project to a structural
            adjustment operation it is important to ensure that the
            teams working on both operations are almost identical or, at
            least, are led by the same task team leader. In low-capacity
            environments focusing Technical Assistance on direct
            capacity building may produce more sustainable impact.
            Limited procurement options might result in non-delivery of
            planned technical assistance assignments that are important
            for the country's development agenda. A capacity
            building component for implementation should be built into
            the project, in those cases when there is not enough time to
            do so in the preparation phase of the project. NGOs can be a
            driving force in the development of innovative projects and
            deliver significant results for relatively small amounts of
            funding, when those NGOs are guided by capable and
            open-minded Centers of Social Work management.
